## Active cases

Active cases are confirmed cases excluding those that led to death or recovery.

```{r}
csse_merged_table <- merge(
  csse_table %>% subset(subset == "confirmed") %>% select(-subset) %>% rename(Confirmed = "count"),
  csse_table %>% subset(subset == "deaths") %>% select(-subset) %>% rename(Deaths = "count"),
  all = TRUE
)
csse_merged_table <- merge(
  csse_merged_table,
  csse_table %>% subset(subset == "recovered") %>% select(-subset) %>% rename(Recovered = "count"),
  all = TRUE
)
csse_merged_table <- csse_merged_table %>% mutate(count = Confirmed - Deaths - Recovered)
```

```{r, warning=FALSE}
csse_merged_table %>% 
    mutate(week = week(date)) %>%
    group_by(`week`, `CountryRegion`) %>%
    summarise(count = max(count)) %>%
    .plot_function(group = plot_group)
```
